isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - CONNECTING RODS, PISTONS, RINGS AND SLEEVES - PISTON & ROD ASSEMBLY REMOVAL - PULL-UP-TO-THE-MARK METHOD

step1.para: Place a socket over the connecting rod bolt then mark the socket and a point on the connecting rod bolt that is in line with the socket mark.
Using a breaker-bar, loosen the bolt one- eighth of a turn.
Without disturbing the socket location, remove the breaker-bar and install a torque wrench in its place.
Turn the bolt until the socket mark and the connecting rod mark is aligned.
With marks aligned, record the torque reading.

figure.caption: Figure 6.2. Remove Carbon Ridge from the Top of Each Cylinder Sleeve.

step1.para: Repeat this procedure for all connecting rod bolts.

note.para: If the torque reading varies by more than 14 Nm (10 lb-ft.) from the specified torque, a CLOSE inspection of the connecting rod cap and bolts is required.

figure.caption: Figure 6.3. Check Bolt Torque (Using Pull-Up-to-the-Mark Method).
